snippet: Former patients at a New Hampshire hospital must wait at least another week to learn if they were infected with hepatitis C through syringes used by a traveling medical technician.
abstract: Thousands of former patients at New Hampshire's Exeter Hospital will have to wait at least one more week before learning if they were infected with hepatitis C through syringes used by traveling medical technician David Kwiatkowski; testing will be delayed as state's health department officials develop an orderly process that will accommodate the large number of patients.
lead_paragraph: Former patients at a New Hampshire hospital must wait at least another week to learn if they were infected with hepatitis C through syringes used by a traveling medical technician.

headline.seo: Thousands Await Testing For Hepatitis By ‘Serial Infector’
headline.main: Thousands Await Testing for Hepatitis by ‘Infector’
headline.print_headline: Thousands Await Testing For Hepatitis By ‘Infector’
